Head: Tynach
hey all: press Ctrl+Alt+F5, and log in. Notice when you put your password in, it will not show little dots or anything - you just have to trust that it is being entered.

Head: Tynach
hey all: Ctrl+Alt+F5 turns you to a terminal. You can use Ctrl+Alt+F7 to get back to the user interface. Linux lets you to go multiple terminals (without interface) by pressing Ctrl+Alt+F(number).

Head: Tynach
hey all: hit the Windows key, and type in 'terminal'. Open the terminal, it should be a dark purple background window with something like "user@computername:~$ ". I want you to type, without quotes: "sudo shutdown -h now". Copy and paste it if you want.
